name: Blau Costa Verde Beach Resort

reviews.title: About Time we got away from Canada
reviews.text: Recently my girlfriend and I took a vacation( Finally) to Holguin, Cuba. We stayed at the Maritime Costa Verde( now called the Blau Costa Verde ) from April 29th to May 6th 2005. I guess the best way to reveiw the trip is to rate each indvidual protion of the trip. Hope this helps anyone wanting to go there.

reviews.title: Loved Cuba, I would not stay at this resort again!
reviews.text: Flights: We were delayed about 1hr and half, which was not that much of an inconvience. Air transat was a far superior airline compared to others we have travelled before. We were given good seats and the movie was great( Oceans Twelve ). The flight back was a little rough with turbulance, and the movie was boring. Flight overall 9/10

reviews.title: worth the visit
reviews.text: $ exchange: Very easy to do, depending when you arrive in Cuba, We received $211 peso's for $300 Canadian. The hotel exchange bank is good as well. 8/10

reviews.title: Nice, but no 4 star
reviews.text: Trip to Hotel: Nice air conditioned bus, trip to about 40 minutes. Absolutely no road safety! 9/10

reviews.title: We miss the Maritim already!
reviews.text: Hotel: Very nice, with lush vegatation and flowers everywhere. Little lizards run around, but they avoid the eating areas. Nice layout to hotel. short walk down to the beach. Pool bar , and snack bar is were the majority of people hang out. It is entertaining to watch the Europeans watch soccer, people started to dance on the bar when their team scored a goal. Italian restaurant is excellent, the cuaban is just as good. Buffet is good. Our room was well kept, but the beds are really hard, and pillows are hard as well. Good water pressure, but a loud toilet. Over all the hotel was great. 8/10

reviews.title: Wonderful Resort!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Maritim Costa Verde from March 26- April 2nd/05. We were a group of 6 adults (2 seniors and 4 others in the 30-40+ range) and Children aged 4 & 2.

reviews.title: Very, Very Nice
reviews.text: We were extremely pleased with everything this resort had to offer. To break it down:

reviews.title: Will Be Returning
reviews.text: Food: Food was definitely a pleasant surprise. Lots of variety and great tasting as well. I highly recommend the banana flambe dessert with chocolate- truly delicious! Also, be sure to visit both a la carte restaurants. The food is fantastic- especially the shrimp cocktail at the Italian restaurant. Our 4 year old loved the virgin pina coladas!

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: Staff: The staff was always smiling and seemed eager to help. Carlos at the snack bar was especially great. Filled our 2 year old son's bottle over and over again with a smile on his face.
Beach: Beautiful! Water was warm and the sand was soft. Snorkelling was great. We also did a catamaran ride which we enjoyed tremendously (with no kids)
reviews.title: Excellent vacation
Loved the people!!!
reviews.text: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the resort from june 12th to 19th. We flew Air-Transat from Montreal to Holguin. The flight was smooth and the bus was ready to pick us up right when we landed. We arrived at the hotel at 19:30, check-in was really fast and the luggage boys are ready for you right away. One thing I did not like was going back to the lobby to ask for the key to the safe and the coupon for the towels, they should give you that right away and not make you come back 2 times.

The room was nice and clean, we stayed in block 6 and the air conditioning could have worked better, but it was enough to be comfortable. Toilets are nice and flush everytime, they are loud but it’s not reason enough to complain. The mattress was perfect, nothing to complain about. The pillows however I found were too hard, I slept on the smaller decoration pillows because they were softer. I could hear something drip all night long inside the walls, but it wasn’t loud enough to keep me from sleeping.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
beautiful holydays
reviews.text: The buffet was good, there was enough variety to find something to eat. Chicken is always a safe choice. The bread and ice-cream are excellent!!! The wine is not at all comparable to what we drink, tastes more like kool-aid. The buffet is the same all week long for breakfeast and lunch, we went to the restaurants every night so we did not try dinner but heard good comments about it (shrimp and langouste).

reviews.title: Best week of my life!
reviews.text: The a la carte restaurants (Italian and Cuban) were decent, always the same menu all week long but there are always safe choices on every menu. The waitresses understand english so it’s easy to ask questions and they are very friendly. The chef that used to be at Maritim (before Blau) is now at Playa Costa Verde, so the food is not as excellent as it was a few months ago but still good.

reviews.title: holiday of a lifetime
reviews.text: The pool did not impress me very much for a few reasons. First, you cannot swim around the pool because once you get to a certain brown section, the water is 1 inch deep. I usually like to do a few laps around the pool but you can’t do that there. There is a section of the pool with a seat and jets (similar to a jacuzi), it worked the first day and then was broken for the rest of the week. Also, the pool is really dirty, you can see black crud incrusted on the walls, they should really start cleaning it, maybe it was because it’s low season and the hotel was at maybe 15% capacity but it was still a bit nasty.

reviews.title: Very pleased with Resort!
reviews.text: Kelly and Carlos, CANADA
2 week vacation-July 17th-July 31st
reviews.title: Got married!!!
Total chill out holiday
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two really great weeks at the Blau Costa Verde Beach Resort located on Playa Pesquero, Holguin, Cuba.  This is a solid 4 star resort in all aspects including accommodation, food, entertainment, activities, ammentities such at the pool, activities room (pool and ping pong), spa and beach club.   Some resorts require the person booking to remove a star….for instance if it says 4, expect 3 but with this hotel this is not the case.  You are getting what is advertised.

reviews.title: One of my fave Places ever!!!
reviews.text: I won’t speak about the flight with Skyservice because I believe that all charters are the same, usually not on time, cramped, terrible meals and just plain old charter service.  Say no more.

At the airport in Holguin we stood in line for immigration for approximately 10 minutes and just a hint for any first time visitors to Cuba….when you fill out your Cuba Tourist Visa don't forget to fill out both sides.  One side is taken at entry and the second half you keep until departure.  They must both be filled out before you arrive at the immigration booth or you will be sent to the back of the line to complete it.  In a long line up day you really don't want this to happen.  I have seen this each and every time I've ever arrived in Cuba.
reviews.title: great holiday
